Interface FIRE

All Known Implementing Classes:
Resort
public interface FIRE
Interface FIRE specifies requirements for 5COM2007 Cwk 3 - Nov 2022.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean canTravel​(int cdId, java.lang.String ferCode)
    Returns true if a pass is allowed to journey using a ferry, false otherwise.
    void convertPoints​(int id)
    Converts a pass's journey points into credits (5 journey points equal 1 credit).
    java.lang.String findPassLocation​(int cd)
    Returns the name of the island which contains the specified pass or "Not found".
    java.lang.String getAllPassesOnAllIslands()
    Returns a String representation of all the passes on all islands with "No passes" if there are no passes on an island.
    java.lang.String getAllPassesOnIsland​(java.lang.String isl)
    Returns a string representation of all the passes on a specified island.
    int getIslandNumber​(java.lang.String isl)
    Given the name of an island, returns the island id number or -1 if island does not exist.
    void topUpCredits​(int id, int creds)
    Adds credits to a pass.
    java.lang.String toString()
    Returns information about the resort including its location/name and all passes currently on each island, or "No passes" (if no pass is on that island).
    java.lang.String travel​(int pPassId, java.lang.String ferCode)
    Gets the result of a pass requesting to journey by ferry.
    java.lang.String viewAPass​(int cd)
    Returns details of the pass with the specified id or "Not found".

    • canTravel

      boolean canTravel​(int cdId, java.lang.String ferCode)
      Returns true if a pass is allowed to journey using a ferry, false otherwise.

      A journey can be made if all the following conditions are true:

      • The rating of the pass is bigger than or equal to the rating of the destination island.
      • The destination island is not full.
      • The pass has sufficient credits (a journey costs 3 credits).
      • The pass is currently in the source island.
      • The pass id and ferry code represent objects in the system.
      Parameters:
      cdId - The id of the pass requesting the move.
      ferCode - The code of the ferry journey by which the pass wants to move.
      Returns:
      Whether the pass is allowed on the ferry journey or not.

    • travel

      java.lang.String travel​(int pPassId, java.lang.String ferCode)
      Gets the result of a pass requesting to journey by ferry.

      A journey will be successful if all the following conditions are true:

      • The rating of the pass is bigger than or equal to the rating of the destination island.
      • The destination island is not full.
      • The pass has sufficient credits (a journey costs 3 credits).
      • The pass is currently in the source island.
      • The pass id and ferry code represent objects in the system.

      If the ferry journey can be made, the pass is removed from the source island, added to the destination island, and a suitable message is returned. Pass information should be updated (a journey costs 3 credits and journey points incremented by 1). If the ferry journey cannot be made, the state of the system remains unchanged and a message specifying the reason is returned.

      Parameters:
      pPassId - The id of the pass requesting the move.
      ferCode - The code of the ferry by which the pass wants to travel.
      Returns:
      The result of the request.

    • topUpCredits

      void topUpCredits​(int id, int creds)
      Adds credits to a pass.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the pass to add credits to.
      creds - The number of credits to add to the pass.

    • convertPoints

      void convertPoints​(int id)
      Converts a pass's journey points into credits (5 journey points equal 1 credit).
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the pass whose points are to be converted.
